title: Assailant in Pawtucket hockey rink shooting killed ex-wife and son, family says
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Robert Dorgan killed his ex-wife Rhonda and son Aidan at a Pawtucket hockey game, then died by suicide.
Dorgan's action also critically injured his former in-laws, Linda and Jerry Dorgan, and a family friend.
A GoFundMe for surviving Dorgan children has been created, aiming to cover living expenses and education costs.

title: Boston’s Vietnamese community celebrates Tết with culture and tradition
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Boston's largest Lunar New Year festival, Tết, was held at Menino Convention & Exhibition Center.
Organized by Vietnamese American Community of Massachusetts, Tết attracted diverse attendees celebrating with traditional food, arts, and performances.
The event's single-day format allowed for increased attendance and showcased cultural education through demonstrations of calligraphy and traditional dresses.

title: How a New Jersey runner is turning the 2026 Boston Marathon into a personal mission
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Kevin Brutus, 30, from Guttenberg, NJ, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of his late father.
Brutus chose to run the marathon after his father's passing from a stroke, emphasizing the importance of seizing moments.
He is part of Tedy's Team, focusing on raising awareness and support for heart disease and stroke research.

title: His future wife survived a medical emergency thanks to Boston MedFlight
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Sean Largay is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to fundraise for Boston MedFlight.
Largay's future wife, Maggie Bea, survived a medical emergency in 2024 thanks to Boston MedFlight.
Boston MedFlight is a non-profit that depends entirely on donations for its life-saving medical missions.

title: He’s running the Boston Marathon to support young athletes
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ahmed Mansour, 45, from Houston, Texas, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the Boston Athletic Academy.
Mansour aims to help underprivileged youth with mentorship and education through his run.
Completing the Boston Marathon will be his 6th in the World Marathon Majors, with Sydney next in August.

title: American Eagle Outfitters to close Devens distribution facility, cutting 103 jobs
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: American Eagle Outfitters to close its Devens distribution center, laying off 103 workers starting April 12.
The Devens center, part of Quiet Logistics, was acquired by American Eagle in 2021 for $360 million.
American Eagle's decision to close Quiet Logistics is part of its strategy to restructure and prioritize growth.

title: Mass. lowers flags to half-staff in honor of fallen soldier Robert Arnold
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Flags across Massachusetts were lowered to half-staff to honor 27-year-old U.S. Army Staff Sgt. Robert R. Arnold.
Arnold, from Roslindale, served in both the U.S. Army and Marine Corps and spoke four languages.
State Rep. Steve Xiarhos highlighted Arnold's service and extended condolences to his family on Facebook.

title: Healey, Ayotte spar over proposed ICE facility in N.H.
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: ICE proposes detention center in Merrimack, N.H., to retrofit a 324,000-square-foot warehouse for 400-600 beds.
Gov. Maura Healey opposes the ICE facility, criticizing its impact on safety and due process; demands Gov. Kelly Ayotte block it.
Gov. Kelly Ayotte challenges Healey's stance, citing Massachusetts' immigration policy issues; demands communication transparency from ICE.

title: Boy Scout rescued from Mount Washington after allergic reaction
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A 15-year-old Boy Scout had a severe allergic reaction near Mount Washington's summit, prompting a rescue operation.
New Hampshire Fish and Game officers were alerted and coordinated a rescue involving a Snowcat and local EMS.
The teen was safely transported to Androscoggin Valley Hospital after first aid was administered by his Scout group.

title: New owner steps in at Grumpy’s
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Thomas Holmes, 28, has acquired Grumpy's restaurant in East Dennis, ensuring no changes to the staff, menu, or operations.
Grumpy's was sold without property ownership, remaining with Jim Manning, and attracted significant buyer interest, according to agent Chuck Carey.
Holmes, with a tech background, says his purchase was fueled by a passion for restaurants and aims to maintain the eatery's legacy.
